intro: Phalolepis alba, commonly known as the white phalolepis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
